alert.note: Alert for Garza (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 9:16AM CDT until May 29 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Garza. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of thunderstorms with intense rainfall rates moving into western Garza County west of Post. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Post, Lake Alan Henry, Justiceburg and Southland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
